flavor:
Step 1: Apply to problem.
Step 2: No more problem!
text: +1[mu] The trash cost of each Corp card is lowered by 1. The first time each turn you trash a Corp card, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Demolisher

flavor: *tap* *tap* *tap*
text:
Install only on a piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each hosted virus counter.
When you encounter host ice, if its strength is 0 or less, trash it. Otherwise, place 1 virus counter on this program.
title: Chisel

flavor: "Net space is an abstraction, a white lie protecting fragile comprehensions. Do not limit yourself." -z\h/r
text: [click]: Run R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, reveal the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of the revealed cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Stargate

flavor: Friends break your walls.
text:
When your turn begins or you steal an agenda, place 1[credit] on this resource.
Whenever you make a successful run, you may spend hosted credits for the remainder of that run.
When your turn ends, if there are 3 or more hosted credits, you must pay 1[credit] or trash this resource.
title: Fencer Fueno

flavor: ...well, I'm laughing.
text: The first time each turn you install a virus program, place 2 virus counters on this resource. When your turn begins, you may remove any 2 virus counters from your installed cards. If you do, draw 2 cards unless the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
title: The Nihilist

flavor: Friends hide your fears.
text:
When your turn begins or you steal an agenda, place 1[credit] on Trickster Taka.
Spend hosted credits during runs to use programs.
When your turn ends, if there are 3[credit] or more on Trickster Taka, take 1 tag or trash Trickster Taka.
title: Trickster Taka

flavor: "You're not listening."
text: The first job resource, connection resource, or piece of hardware you install each turn costs 1[credit] less to install.
title: Az McCaffrey: Mechanical Prodigy

flavor: "Everyone told me she was reliable in a pinch" - Az McCaffrey
text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was unsuccessful, you may run that server again, ignoring any additional cost to run. During the second run, when you encounter the last piece of ice you encountered in the first run, bypass it.
title: Always Have a Backup Plan

flavor: Blue flames burn the hottest!
text: Look at the top 2 cards of your stack. You may add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack. Draw 2 cards.
title: Blueberry!â„¢ Diesel

flavor: BMI switches let runners surface without true disconnects. Handy if you need a break... immediately.
text:
You cannot use this hardware during the Corp's turn.
[trash]: Jack out.
[trash]: Remove 1 tag.
Whenever a trace initiates on your turn, you may [trash] to reduce the base trace strength to 0.
title: Flip Switch

flavor: Want to win a coinflip? Use one with two heads.
text: Remove this hardware from the game: Prevent a run from ending due to an effect of a Corp card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.
title: Lucky Charm

flavor:
v35: Springs to the mount ejectors (new feature)
v36: Reduced power to springs (x5)
text: +1[mu]. The first time each turn you install a piece of hardware, draw 1 card. Whenever a run begins, you may install a piece of hardware, paying 1[credit] more. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Masterwork (v37)

flavor: "Do the job. Get paid. Leave feelings at the door." - "Baklan" Bochkin
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. The first time each turn that you break all subroutines on a piece of ice you are encountering using only this program, gain 2[credit].
title: Bukhgalter

flavor: "Psh, let them gossip. The cat knows whose meat it has eaten" - "Baklan" Bochkin
text:
The first time each run you encounter a piece of ice, place 1 power counter on this resource.
[trash]: Derez the ice you are encountering if its strength is equal or less than the number of power counters. Take 1 tag.
title: "Baklan" Bochkin

flavor: ...but I am without compare.
text:
When the turn during which you installed this resource ends, draw 4 cards.
The first time each turn you would draw, instead look at the top X cards of your stack. Add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack, then draw the rest. X equals the number of cards you would have drawn plus 1.
title: The Class Act

text: When your turn ends, if you have the same number of cards in your grip as the Corp has in HQ, you may draw 1 card.
title: Lat: Ethical Freelancer

flavor: Do you know how many food deliveries I've missed this week?
text:
Play only as your first [click].
Whenever you install a card with a printed install cost of 1 or greater this turn, draw 1 card or gain 1[credit].
title: In the Groove

flavor: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not posession, but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.
text: When you install this program, it gets +3 strength for the remainder of the turn. 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength.
title: Gauss

flavor: It makes Sysops see red. And orange, yellow, green...
text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Hosted virus counter: Choose an ice subtype. The ice you are encountering gains that subtype for the remainder of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Pelangi

flavor: "It takes such simple things to sustain us, the most important of which is to be thankful." - Lat
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
title: Rezeki

flavor: ...then let me paint you a picture.
text:
Use each ability on this resource only once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
[click]: Install a program or piece of hardware, paying 1[credit] less.
title: The Artist

flavor: Have you tried turning it off an on again?
text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip. If you do, you may install a program or piece of hardware, paying X[credit] less. X is equal to the printed install cost of the uninstalled card.
title: Rejig

flavor: "Corporations are made of people; just normal people doing their 6-to-6. The right truths, the right critique, and they can be redeemed." - Lat
text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may trash this resource to name an agenda. The next time this run you access a copy of the named agenda, steal it, ignoring all costs. (You are no longer accessing it.)
title: Whistleblower

text: If the first, second, and third actions you take on your turn are different from each other, when the third completes, you may gain 1[credit] or take another different action, paying 1[click] less.
title: MirrorMorph: Endless Iteration

flavor: Unit is holding .78 asimovs of stress potential in all three directive logic traps. Psychiatric session mandated during next maintenance cycle.
text:
[click]: Draw 2 cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
When the Runner trashes this asset, you may draw 2 cards.
title: Calvin B4L3Y

flavor: At the scale where nanobots cut glass, quantum mechanics dictate error. A silicon atom here, an oxygen there, an erbium out of place. Each bioroid is born unique.
text:
[click]: Gain 2[credit]. Use this ability only once per turn.
When the Runner trashes Nanoetching Matrix, you may gain 2[credit].
title: Nanoetching Matrix

flavor: Old warriors have seen all the tricks; be forthright or fail.
text: This ice has -1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [subroutine] Trash 1 program that is not a decoder, fracter, or killer. [subroutine] End the run.
title: Hagen

flavor: Haas' unsecured servers were fortified just before the storm. Are their bioroid oracles that good, or were they tipped off?
text: Gain 2[credit] or draw 2 cards. Repeat this process for each remote server with at least 1 card in it and at least 1 piece of ice protecting it.
title: Fully Operational

flavor: Not all secrets lie in vaults.
text:
Resolve two of the following in any order:
  • Draw 2 cards.
  • Gain 2[credit].
  • Install up to 1 non-agenda card.
  • Gain [click].
title: Red Level Clearance

flavor: No Stone Unturned
text:
The first time each turn you reveal a card, gain 1[credit].
[click]: Reveal a card from the grip at random or the top card of the stack.
title: Hyoubu Institute: Absolute Clarity

text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, choose a card type. For the remainder of the encounter, whenever you trash a card of that type with net damage from a subroutine on this ice, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Saisentan

flavor: We see you.
text:
After you resolve this operation, your action phase ends.
Play only if the Runner has 3 or more agenda points and they made a successful run during their last turn.
Name a card, then do 1 net damage. If you trash a copy of the named card, repeat this process.
title: Complete Image

text: The first time each run the runner approaches this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, you may trash this upgrade to force the runner to approach the outermost piece of ice protecting this server.
title: Letheia Nisei

flavor:
Scrub-loving devs nerfed cannon rushes cause whiny bronzers complained. Left me four wins down in finals.
Anyway I won.
text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on an installed card.
title: Remastered Edition

flavor: Subscribe for 12 months to get that premium uplink you need to blaze ahead of the crowd!
text: The first time each turn a run begins, gain 1[credit].
title: Tiered Subscription

flavor: You are the ONE BILLIONTH visitor!
text:
When the Runner passes this ice, gain 1[credit].
[subroutine]Gain 2[credit]. The Runner gains 1[credit].
title: Congratulations!

flavor: "There's gonna be catering, right?"
text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during their last turn.
Choose a card type, then reveal the grip. You may pay X[credit] to place X advancement tokens on an installed card. X is equal to or less than the number of revealed cards of the chosen type.
title: Focus Group

flavor: It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a Troll.
text: Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during their last turn. Choose a Runner card type. Trash all installed non-icebreaker cards of that type. The Runner may prevent any of those cards from being trashed by paying 3[credit] each. Take 1 bad publicity.
title: Game Over

flavor: As the documents show, for eight months they have operated as an entirely independent fiscal entity. We are as appalled at the carelessness as you are, and fully support City Hall's investigation.
text: Whenever the Runner steals another agenda, you may forfeit this agenda to gain 5[credit] and add the stolen agenda to HQ.
title: Divested Trust

flavor: "There's something about the human touch that androids will never replace" - Mila Braun
text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 6[credit]. You may remove 1 bad publicity.
title: Roughneck Repair Squad

flavor: Effective, Cheap, Durable. Pick two.
text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, place 1 virus counter on it.
This ice has -1 strength for each hosted virus counter.
[subroutine]End the run.
title: Sandstone

text:
When you rez this ice, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed Runner card.
[subroutine]<trace>trace 6</trace>: If successful, the Runner cannot steal or trash Corp cards for the remainder of the run.
title: Trebuchet

flavor: The Fracture was no different to any other crisis: Management's first instinct is to find someone to blame. Getting food up to Midway or He3 down to power Earthside hospitals are trivialities compared to the important work of salving Executive ego and keeping one's job.
text: You cannot score this agenda if you installed it this turn.
title: Vulnerability Audit

flavor:
"By matching funds on your donations, the Space Elevator Authority has already planted over eight million trees on the Pacific coast. Together we can restore New Angeles to its former glory."
- Elizabeth Mills
text: When your turn begins, you may draw 1 card.
title: CSR Campaign

text:
During runs on this server, you can rez this ice any time you could rez non-ice cards.
Each piece of ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
[subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit].
title: Rime
